# kvImageConvert_OrderedUniformBlue

**Global Variable**

A constant that indicates the conversion will distribute the noise uniformly.

## Declaration

```swift
var kvImageConvert_OrderedUniformBlue: UInt32 { get }
```

## Discussion

The following shows an 8-bit RGB image converted to a 1-bit planar image with [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageConvert_Planar8toPlanar1(_:_:_:_:_:)] using [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/kvImageConvert_DitherOrderedReproducible]. The image on the left uses [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/kvImageConvert_OrderedGaussianBlue], and the image on the right uses [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/kvImageConvert_OrderedUniformBlue]:



To learn about converting an RGB image to grayscale, see [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Accelerate/converting-color-images-to-grayscale].

## Constants

- **kvImageConvert_DitherNone**: A constant that indicates the conversion will not apply dithering.
- **kvImageConvert_DitherOrdered**: A constant that indicates the conversion will add randomized, pre-computed blue noise to the image.
- **kvImageConvert_DitherOrderedReproducible**: A constant that indicates the conversion will add reproducible, pre-computed blue noise to the image.
- **kvImageConvert_DitherFloydSteinberg**: A constant that indicates the conversion will add Floyd-Steinberg dithering to the image.
- **kvImageConvert_DitherAtkinson**: A constant that indicates the conversion will add Atkinson dithering to the image.
- **kvImageConvert_OrderedGaussianBlue**: A constant that indicates the conversion will distribute the noise according to a Gaussian distribution.
- **kvImageConvert_OrderedNoiseShapeMask**
